    • Support the Playhouse! Donations As a Community Theatre we rely on the sale of tickets and the generosity of our patrons and supporters. Your tax deductible donation is put to good use and deeply appreciated . All donors are listed in each of our programs throughout the season. Please consider one of the following levels or any other amount you wish : Benefactor ($2,500+) Platinum Angel ($1,000+) Golden Angel ($500+) Silver Angel ($250+) Angel ($100+) Sponsor ($50+) Patron ($25+) Donate Here The Daytona Playhouse is a nonprofit, tax-exempt, donation supported organization under Section 501 (c)(3) of the IRS Code, and is incorporated and registered in the State of Florida. All donations are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law. A copy of the official registration and financial information for Daytona Playhouse, Inc., a Florida-based nonprofit corporation (Registration No. CH34403), may be obtained from the Division of Consumer Services by calling toll-free 1-800-HELP-FLA (435-7352) within the State or visiting their website here . Registration does not imply endorsement, approval or recommendation by the State. Fundraising At Daytona Playhouse, our fundraising events are more than just opportunities to give. They’re vibrant celebrations of theatre, community, and creativity! With themed evenings, behind-the-scenes experiences, and exclusive performances, these events are designed to connect you directly to the magic of live stage production. Why attend? Your presence helps support upcoming shows, our Young Actors Company, and essential theatre maintenance — all while enjoying a memorable evening. What to expect: Delicious refreshments, live entertainment, special guests, and unique auction items plus a full behind-the-scenes peek at how our productions come together. Who benefits: Every dollar raised supports our mission: bringing high-quality, community-driven theatre to Daytona Beach and Volusia County, year after year. Keep an eye on our Fundraisers page for dates, tickets, and more ways to participate. When you support our events, you’re not just investing in a night out, you’re investing in community, creativity, and the theatre. Our Upcoming Fundraisers Membership Who can be a Member? According to our By-laws, “Any person who is interested in forwarding the purposes and in promoting the DAYTONA PLAYHOUSE, INC., who shall pay such Membership dues as prescribed by the EXECUTIVE BOARD, and only such a person, shall be a Member.” Membership is only $10 per year! How do you become a Member? You can print and mail in a membership form with your payment or you can do so online. Become a Member Online Become a Member by Mail Membership has perks! Yearly membership card Right to serve as a board member Right to vote in the annual election for board officers (must be paid by April 1, 2026) Other member-only perks to be announced throughout the year! Best Seat in the House How does this work? Savor your own little piece of the Playhouse by having your name engraved on a seat in our newly renovated theatre. Naming a seat is a unique way to acknowledge your support of the Daytona Playhouse or to honor or remember a special individual. Each seat can be sponsored for a donation of $200 Just print out the order form and reserve your seat today! Download the Order Form As a seat sponsor, you will receive: Your name or the name of a loved one engraved on a 2” x 4” plate The plate is permanently affixed to the back of the seat of your choice Each plate can include up to three rows of text Each row can include up to 25 characters each Seat assignments are available on a first-come, first-serve basis Advertise! Full page ads Half-page ads Quarter-page ads Eighth-page ads ❮ ❯ Your advertising investment supports the following: Show production , including set construction, royalties, rentals, costuming, promotion and much, much more. Maintenance and improvements to the Daytona Playhouse Educational programs for our youth, including our Young Actors Company theatre summer camps. Technical improvements for our productions, including audio systems, rear screen projections and new technologies to come. Special programming such as Reader’s Theatre, Off-Center Stage Productions, and collaboration with other arts organizations. Advertise With Us!     • About Daytona Playhouse Daytona Playhouse is dedicated to enriching our community and visitors through the power of live theatre. With a mission to provide diverse and innovative theatre experiences, we offer high-quality productions and creative opportunities for all ages. Our goal is to promote appreciation for and education in all phases of theatre arts. Daytona Playhouse is a not-for-profit community theatre serving the community since 1946, run primarily by 200+ volunteers and financially supporting itself through ticket sales and donations. It truly takes a dedicated group of volunteers to ensure the Daytona Playhouse not only survives but flourishes. Our Playhouse Auditorium: View of the Stage Auditorium: View of Our Seating Main Entrance Lobby River View Our People Board of Directors The Officers of the Daytona Playhouse Executive Board are a President, four (4) Vice-Presidents (Production, Fundraising, Publicity, and Facility Management), a Secretary, and a Treasurer. The Officers are elected by a plurality of member votes cast at the Annual Meeting and hold office for two years. The Executive Board meets monthly and is responsible for the successful operation of the Playhouse and ensuring its long term viability. Board President Kathy Thompson Secretary Heather Strickland Treasurer Rick Bowman VP of Facility Management Joe Firrantello VP of Fundraising Robin Bassett VP of Production Sunnie Rice VP of Publicity Dawn Sauer Past President Danny Crile Committee Chairs The General Board of Directors is composed of the members of the Executive Board and the chairs of the standing and special committees. Chairs are appointed by the President with Executive Board approval. Auditions Ann Flibotte Auditions Norman Flibotte Box Office Frank Butterfield Concessions Stephen Andrews Construction Liaison Joe Firrantello Construction Liaison Norman Flibotte Costumes Sunnie Rice Graphics Jerry Doty Historian Frank Butterfield House Managers Tom Hansen Membership Kathleen McKay Program Advertising Frank Butterfield Props Roberta Travani Raffles Oona Carillo Readers Socials Bethany Stillion Lights Dale Gray Sound John Mirabile Traveling Troupe Madeline Santoro Ushers Heather Strickland Volunteer Coordinator Heather Strickland Advisory Board The Advisory Board is composed of members of the community who contribute their expertise to furthering the ongoing development of the Playhouse. Advisory Board members are appointed by the President with Executive Board approval. Advisor D. Glenn Vincent Volunteers We appreciate our volunteers! Concessions Light Board Sound Board Ushers Usher Set Construction Raffle Set Construction ❮ ❯ Become a Volunteer!     • Melissa Cargile With 46 years experience as a pianist/pit musician and 30 years as a music director, Melissa frequently works in area theaters, is a church pianist and freelances as both pianist and music director in many different venues. Recent productions include Urinetown , Bonnie and Clyde , Percy Jackson and the Lightning Thief , The Great American Trailer Park Musical (also co-director), and A Charlie Brown Christmas . Melissa is a proud member of American Federation of Musicians Local 389. Crew 2025-2026 All Shook Up Director All Shook Up Musical Director 2024-2025 Something Rotten!     • How To Reach Us 386-255-2431 boxoffice at daytonaplayhouse dot org 100 Jessamine Blvd Daytona Beach, FL 32118 Box Office Hours Friday, September 12th 2:00 pm — 4:00 pm Friday, September 12th 5:30 pm — 7:30 pm Saturday, September 13th 5:30 pm — 7:30 pm Explore Our Calendar Box Office Online Email checked and replied to several times daily. Voicemail checked and replied to every Tuesday and Friday. Map Parking Our main parking lot is between the main entrance and the Halifax River. You can also park in any unmarked and unnumbered space in our neighbor’s lot at Bayshore Condominiums. ADA parking is on the river side of the main entrance and on the north side of the building. Give yourself extra time for parking before our Sunday matinee shows as they tend to sell out. For busier shows, follow the directions offered by our volunteers in the parking lot who will direct you to the best place to park when you arrive.
